conversation.content: So, um, I've been analyzing our, [very slowly], inventory metrics and basically, you know, we're turning stock way too slowly.
Oh no, how bad are we talking? I noticed the warehouse looked pretty packed last week, but I didn't realize it was becoming an actual problem.
We're at 4.2 turns per year.
Wait, only four times? That's rough, especially if we're trying to free up cash flow - what's causing the bottleneck, do you think?
Er, poor forecasting mostly, I mean, we're ordering based on gut feel instead of, sort of, actual demand patterns.
That explains why we have like three months of those blue widgets sitting around! Have you calculated how much working capital we're tying up unnecessarily?
Well, about $180,000 that could, honestly, be used elsewhere, like, for marketing or equipment upgrades.
Uh, that's actually insane when you think about it - the thing is, we're basically using our warehouse as the world's most expensive storage unit.
Hmm, the worst part is, I guess, [very melancholic] some of this inventory is becoming obsolete anyway, which means write-offs.
How much are we [whispering] looking at writing off? Because if it's significant, we need to tell the boss before quarter-end hits.
So, probably uhh, fifteen to twenty thousand, kind of depends on what we can salvage.
Ouch. Have you thought about implementing just-in-time ordering or maybe negotiating better payment terms with suppliers to help with the cash crunch?
I've modeled both scenarios in Excel.
Of course you have! What's the projected improvement if we switch systems? And please tell me it's dramatic enough to justify the hassle.
We could hit eight turns annually with proper implementation.
Double our current rate? That's [yawn] amazing actually - sorry, been up since four studying for my supply chain certification exam.
Err, the ROI is [smiling speaking] compelling, right so, payback period is under six months, it's just that, convincing management might be tricky.
Ah, they really hate change, but here's the thing, we can't keep bleeding cash like this - maybe start with a pilot program?
Smart. Test it with our top ten SKUs first.
Umm, I can help build the presentation if you want, okay so, we make it super visual and pretty much impossible to say no to.
